author: Paul Rankin
method: For the caramelised spiced pineapple, heat the sugar, the vanilla and cardamom seeds and the cinnamon in a non-stick frying pan until the sugar is melted and caramelised. Add the pineapple and lime juice and stir. Remove from the heat and place onto a serving plate along with the pan juices. For the sabayon, place the egg yolks, wine and sugar into a heatproof bowl set over a pan of barely simmering water and whisk continuously until the mixture is thick and frothy. To serve, drizzle the sabayon over the pineapple.
ingredients: 100g/3½oz caster sugar,  1 vanilla pod, split and seeds scraped out,  1 cardamom pod, crushed,  1 tsp ground cinnamon,  ½ pineapple, peeled, cored and sliced,  ½ lime, juice only,  3 free-range egg yolks,  4 tbsp white wine,  55g/2oz caster sugar
